abstract: Would money motivate you to study and succeed in school?
snippet: Would money motivate you to study and succeed in school?
lead_paragraph: As part of the National Math and Science Initiative, some high schools have opened up their Advanced Placement courses to all students, and those who score a 3 or higher on the A.P. exam earn a $100 reward, as do their teachers. What do you think of financial incentives to perform well in school? Would you study harder if there were a cash bonus attached to a good grade?

headline.main: Should Schools Offer Cash Bonuses for Good Test Scores?
